meanings.definition: Relating to or causing cell division
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the mitogenic effects of the chemical on cells.
meanings.sent2: The mitogenic properties of the compound were essential for the growth of new tissues.
meanings.sent3: The mitogenic nature of the fertilizer made the plants grow like crazy!
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a mitogenic force, inspiring others to take action.
meanings.sent5: The mitogenic power of the music made the audience feel alive and energized.

meanings.definition: A substance that stimulates cell division
meanings.sent1: The researchers discovered a new mitogenic in the soil sample.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use mitogenics to promote cell growth in certain medical treatments.
meanings.sent3: The mitogenic in the pet food made the fish grow bigger than expected!
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a mitogenic, sparking creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The mitogenic added to the plant food accelerated the growth of the flowers.
